Comments_List: I learned more french grammar, as well as developed the ability to read french books at a higher level.
I am almost fluent in french!!!
I greatly improved in my speaking and grammar capabilities during this class-- I also learned alot about the French culture such as WWII
More facility with French and knowledge of the French diaspora.
mme burton is a delight and made this class actually enjoyable. its a ton of work so make sure you have enough space in your schedule to commit the time to it.

The self-reading of un sac de billes was a lot on a night-by-night basis, so maybe dedicate a little more time to reading the book, and cut out one of the diversite stories (don't cut out l'amertune).
I hope the course evaluation audio programs could be more clear with the correct answers for students to check and learn from the mistakes

I dont love the discussions of the Holocaust in my second language, as this can be very traumatic and its limiting to discuss without the proper language. Otherwise well-organized, thiugh intense of course.
if you have the time, yes. if not, it would be really tough to keep-up with all of the readings and exercises. also would recommend taking it specifically with professor burton if you can.
Yes, although the workload is fairly large and the class meets every day, I feel as though my french significantly improved over the course of the semester.
Yes but it is alot of work
Good next step after 130 for oral ability.
